com.sri.ai.grinder.theory.differencearithmetic

Class ValuesOfSingleVariableDifferenceArithmeticConstraintStepSolver

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sri.ai.grinder.core.solver.AbstractExpressionWithPropagatedLiteralsStepSolver
      • com.sri.ai.grinder.theory.numeric.AbstractSingleVariableNumericConstraintFeasibilityRegionStepSolver
        • com.sri.ai.grinder.theory.differencearithmetic.AbstractSingleVariableDifferenceArithmeticConstraintFeasibilityRegionStepSolver
          • com.sri.ai.grinder.theory.differencearithmetic.ValuesOfSingleVariableDifferenceArithmeticConstraintStepSolver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ExpressionLiteralSplitterStepSolver, ExpressionStepSolver, LiteralSplitterStepSolver<Expression>, StepSolver<Expression>, java.lang.Cloneable

    @Beta
public class ValuesOfSingleVariableDifferenceArithmeticConstraintStepSolver
extends AbstractSingleVariableDifferenceArithmeticConstraintFeasibilityRegionStepSolver
    A step solver computing the possible values of the variable of a single-variable difference arithmetic constraint.
    Author:
    braz

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.sri.ai.grinder.api.ExpressionLiteralSplitterStepSolver

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ValuesOfSingleVariableDifferenceArithmeticConstraintStepSolver clone()
      A cloning method delegating to super.clone().
      Expression getSolutionExpressionForBoundVariable()
      Provides the solution when the variable is bound to a value and it has already been decided that the constraint is satisfiable.
      Expression getSolutionExpressionForUnboundedVariables()
      Provides the solution when variable is unbounded (that is, has either lower or upper bound equal to Expressions.MINUS_INFINITY or Expressions.INFINITY) and AbstractSingleVariableNumericConstraintFeasibilityRegionStepSolver.unboundedVariableProducesShortCircuitSolution() returns true.
      Expression getSolutionExpressionGivenBoundsAndDistinctDisequals(Expression greatestStrictLowerBound, Expression leastNonStrictUpperBound, Expression boundsDifference, Expression distinctDisequalsSet, Context context)
      Concrete extensions must implement this method to provide a solution given the already computed strict maximum lower bound, non-strict minimum upper bound, and an extensional uni-set of distinct disequals (terms from which the variable is constrained to be disequal).
      boolean unboundedVariableProducesShortCircuitSolution()
      Indicates whether the fact that the variable is unbounded (that is, has either lower or upper bound equal to Expressions.MINUS_INFINITY or Expressions.INFINITY) means that we can immediate return the solution provided by AbstractSingleVariableNumericConstraintFeasibilityRegionStepSolver.getSolutionExpressionForUnboundedVariables().

      • unboundedVariableProducesShortCircuitSolution

        public boolean unboundedVariableProducesShortCircuitSolution()
        Description copied from class: AbstractSingleVariableNumericConstraintFeasibilityRegionStepSolver
        Indicates whether the fact that the variable is unbounded (that is, has either lower or upper bound equal to Expressions.MINUS_INFINITY or Expressions.INFINITY) means that we can immediate return the solution provided by AbstractSingleVariableNumericConstraintFeasibilityRegionStepSolver.getSolutionExpressionForUnboundedVariables().

      • getSolutionExpressionForUnboundedVariables

        public Expression getSolutionExpressionForUnboundedVariables()
        Description copied from class: AbstractSingleVariableNumericConstraintFeasibilityRegionStepSolver
        Provides the solution when variable is unbounded (that is, has either lower or upper bound equal to Expressions.MINUS_INFINITY or Expressions.INFINITY) and AbstractSingleVariableNumericConstraintFeasibilityRegionStepSolver.unboundedVariableProducesShortCircuitSolution() returns true.
        Specified by:
        getSolutionExpressionForUnboundedVariables in class AbstractSingleVariableNumericConstraintFeasibilityRegionStepSolver
        Returns:

      • getSolutionExpressionForBoundVariable

        public Expression getSolutionExpressionForBoundVariable()
        Description copied from class: AbstractSingleVariableNumericConstraintFeasibilityRegionStepSolver
        Provides the solution when the variable is bound to a value and it has already been decided that the constraint is satisfiable.

        Here are two illustrations of this method's use. If the implementation is deciding model counting, for example, this will be the expression 1, whereas if the implementation is computing the set of satisfying values, this will be one of the elements provided by the method AbstractSingleVariableNumericConstraintFeasibilityRegionStepSolver.getEquals().

        Specified by:
        getSolutionExpressionForBoundVariable in class AbstractSingleVariableNumericConstraintFeasibilityRegionStepSolver
        Returns:

      • getSolutionExpressionGivenBoundsAndDistinctDisequals

        public Expression getSolutionExpressionGivenBoundsAndDistinctDisequals(Expression greatestStrictLowerBound,
                                                                       Expression leastNonStrictUpperBound,
                                                                       Expression boundsDifference,
                                                                       Expression distinctDisequalsSet,
                                                                       Context context)
        Description copied from class: AbstractSingleVariableDifferenceArithmeticConstraintFeasibilityRegionStepSolver
        Concrete extensions must implement this method to provide a solution given the already computed strict maximum lower bound, non-strict minimum upper bound, and an extensional uni-set of distinct disequals (terms from which the variable is constrained to be disequal).

        Specified by:
        getSolutionExpressionGivenBoundsAndDistinctDisequals in class AbstractSingleVariableDifferenceArithmeticConstraintFeasibilityRegionStepSolver
        distinctDisequalsSet - an extensional uni-set of distinct disequals within the bounds.
        Returns:
